what: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
title: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
text: chinadevfin2 primarily data package enabling efficient method working AidData’s Global Chinese Development Finance Dataset, Version 2.0 (GCDF 2.0) R.

title: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
text: AidData’s summary dataset: AidData’s Global Chinese Development Finance Dataset, Version 2.0. records known universe projects (development, commercial, representational intent) supported official financial -kind commitments (pledges) China 2000-2017, implementation details covering 22-year period (2000-2021). dataset captures 13,427 projects worth $843 billion financed 300 Chinese government institutions state-owned entities across 165 countries every major region world. AidData systematically collected quality-assured projects dataset using 2.0 version Tracking Underreported Financial Flows (TUFF) methodology. Please see AidData’s dataset website full citation details. unfamiliar dataset, following resources great place start: AidData - Policy Report: Banking Belt Road: Insights new global dataset 13,427 Chinese development projects AidData - Methodology: Tracking Underreported Financial Flows (TUFF) methodology, 2.0. AidData - Dataset Website: Global Chinese Development Finance Dataset, Version 2.0

title: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
text: chinadevfin2 still heavy development: Please use accordingly. initial phase package development aims finalize stable versions datasets, announced new package version release note. development focus building helper functions aid efficient analysis workflows dataset. chinadevfin2 personal project: package author works consultant AidData package personal project official affiliation sponsorship AidData. author built package use, hopes can grow robust package can aid researchers, policymakers, others interested gaining actionable, empirically-based insights Chinese development finance lending using GCDF 2.0 dataset.

title: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
text: can install development version chinadevfin2 GitHub : package likely never published CRAN data file sizes big.
code: # install the `devtools` package if not yet installed # install.packages("devtools")  # install chinadevfin2 from GitHub devtools::install_github("t-emery/chinadevfin2")

title: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset
text: core initial functionality chinadevfin2 load GCDF 2.0 dataset tibble using get_gcdf2_dataset(): gcdf2_data_dictionary contains AidData’s detailed data definitions GCDF 2.0 variables: makes easy find actionable insights quickly. Let’s look growth concessional versus non-concessional lending years covered dataset (2000-2017).
code: # load the chinadevfin2 library library(chinadevfin2) library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.1      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors  # Load the GCDF 2.0 dataset as a tibble, with standardized country names added at the beginning. get_gcdf2_dataset() #> # A tibble: 13,427 × 73 #>    country_name iso3c country_or_regional aid_data_tuff_project_id #>    <chr>        <chr> <chr>                                  <dbl> #>  1 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53631 #>  2 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53632 #>  3 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53633 #>  4 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53634 #>  5 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53636 #>  6 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53637 #>  7 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53644 #>  8 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53999 #>  9 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                54396 #> 10 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                56587 #> # ℹ 13,417 more rows #> # ℹ 69 more variables: recommended_for_aggregates <chr>, umbrella <chr>, #> #   financier_country <chr>, recipient <chr>, recipient_region <chr>, #> #   commitment_year <dbl>, commitment_year_estimated <chr>, #> #   implementation_start_year <dbl>, completion_year <dbl>, title <chr>, #> #   description <chr>, staff_comments <chr>, status <chr>, intent <chr>, #> #   flow_type <chr>, concessional <chr>, flow_class <chr>, sector_code <dbl>, … # Load the GCDF 2.0 data dictionary as a tibble gcdf2_data_dictionary #> # A tibble: 70 × 4 #>    column_name                column_class field_name                description #>    <chr>                      <chr>        <chr>                     <chr>       #>  1 aid_data_tuff_project_id   numeric      AidData TUFF Project ID   "This fiel… #>  2 recommended_for_aggregates character    Recommended For Aggregat… "This fiel… #>  3 umbrella                   character    Umbrella                  "This fiel… #>  4 financier_country          character    Financier Country         "This fiel… #>  5 recipient                  character    Recipient                 "This fiel… #>  6 recipient_region           character    Recipient Region          "This fiel… #>  7 commitment_year            numeric      Commitment Year           "This fiel… #>  8 commitment_year_estimated  character    Commitment Year Estimated "For proje… #>  9 implementation_start_year  numeric      Implementation Start Year "This fiel… #> 10 completion_year            numeric      Completion Year           "This fiel… #> # ℹ 60 more rows concessional_vs_non_concenssional <- get_gcdf2_dataset() |>    # See `recommended_for_aggregates` in the gcdf2_data_dictionary to learn more about this.    filter(recommended_for_aggregates == "Yes") |>    # Group by the commitment year and whether the loand is concessional   group_by(commitment_year, concessional) |>    # Find the sum by year and concessionality type in constant 2017 USD   summarize(commitments = sum(amount_constant_usd2017, na.rm = TRUE)) |>    # ungroup to avoid strange side effects of grouped tibbles   ungroup() |>    # make prettier names for a chart or table   mutate(label_for_chart = case_when(concessional=="Yes" ~ "Concessional",                                      concessional=="No" ~ "Non-Concessional",                                      concessional=="Vague" ~ "Unclear",                                      )) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'commitment_year'. You can override using #> the `.groups` argument.  concessional_vs_non_concenssional #> # A tibble: 54 × 4 #>    commitment_year concessional commitments label_for_chart  #>              <dbl> <chr>              <dbl> <chr>            #>  1            2000 No             35730163. Non-Concessional #>  2            2000 Vague        1515226164. Unclear          #>  3            2000 Yes          2068689349. Concessional     #>  4            2001 No            197609156. Non-Concessional #>  5            2001 Vague        3876972191. Unclear          #>  6            2001 Yes          4139903249. Concessional     #>  7            2002 No           1303999712. Non-Concessional #>  8            2002 Vague        1524781321. Unclear          #>  9            2002 Yes          3212037121. Concessional     #> 10            2003 No            659706286. Non-Concessional #> # ℹ 44 more rows concessional_vs_non_concenssional |>    ggplot(aes(x = commitment_year, y = commitments, fill = label_for_chart)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   scale_fill_brewer("blues") +   theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_dollar(suffix = " bn", scale = 1/10^9, accuracy = 1)) +   labs(title = "Chinese Development Finance Loan Commitments",        subtitle = "With the chinadevfin2 R package,\n we can find actionable insights quickly",        x = "Commitment Year",        y = "Commitments (2017 Constant USD)",        fill = "",        caption = "Data: AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance Dataset, 2.0\nUsing the chinadevfin2 R package") +   theme(legend.position="top")

what: chinadevfin2: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — chinadevfin2-package
title: chinadevfin2: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — chinadevfin2-package
text: `chinadevfin2` package working AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset. dataset includes 13,427 projects worth $843 billion across 165 countries. `chinadevfin2` provides easy way R users load dataset, helper functions ease common analysis workflows.

title: chinadevfin2: An R Package for AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — chinadevfin2-package

title: Standardized Country Names — gcdf2_standardized_countrynames
text: tibble providing standardized country names, iso3c codes, column filter country-specific regional projects. Country names standardized using countrycode::countryname().

title: Standardized Country Names — gcdf2_standardized_countrynames
Standardized Country Names — gcdf2_standardized_countrynames
text: tibble 70 rows 4 variables: recipient chr loan recipient listed recipient column gcdf2_dataset. See gcdf2_data_dictionary details. country_name chr standardized country name provided countrycode::countryname(). project regional, region listed recipient used. iso3c chr iso3c country code can helpful joining country features. Projects recipient region NA values. country_or_regional chr column allow filtering country-based lending regional lending.

what: Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
title: Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
text: get_gcdf2_dataset() makes easy load AidData's Global Chinese Development Finance Dataset, Version 2.0 (GCDF 2.0). default, function adds standardized country names make easier merge datasets.  standardized country names described documentation gcdf2_standardized_countrynames. Setting standardized_countrynames = FALSE equivalent simply calling gcdf2_dataset data object.  data definitions available gcdf2_data_dictionary.

title: Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
text: standardized_countrynames set TRUE default, argument attaches standardized country names make easier join dataset datasets.

title: Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
text: get_gcdf2_dataset() returns tibble 13,427 observations.

title: Load the AidData Global Chinese Development Finance 2.0 Dataset — get_gcdf2_dataset
code: # returns the GCDF 2.0 dataset, with standardized country names get_gcdf2_dataset() #> # A tibble: 13,427 × 73 #>    country_name iso3c country_or_regional aid_data_tuff_project_id #>    <chr>        <chr> <chr>                                  <dbl> #>  1 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53631 #>  2 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53632 #>  3 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53633 #>  4 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53634 #>  5 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53636 #>  6 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53637 #>  7 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53644 #>  8 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                53999 #>  9 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                54396 #> 10 Afghanistan  AFG   country                                56587 #> # ℹ 13,417 more rows #> # ℹ 69 more variables: recommended_for_aggregates <chr>, umbrella <chr>, #> #   financier_country <chr>, recipient <chr>, recipient_region <chr>, #> #   commitment_year <dbl>, commitment_year_estimated <chr>, #> #   implementation_start_year <dbl>, completion_year <dbl>, title <chr>, #> #   description <chr>, staff_comments <chr>, status <chr>, intent <chr>, #> #   flow_type <chr>, concessional <chr>, flow_class <chr>, sector_code <dbl>, …  # returns the GCDF 2.0 dataset as-is. get_gcdf2_dataset(standardized_countrynames = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 13,427 × 70 #>    aid_data_tuff_project_id recommended_for_aggrega…¹ umbrella financier_country #>                       <dbl> <chr>                     <chr>    <chr>             #>  1                    53631 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  2                    53632 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  3                    53633 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  4                    53634 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  5                    53636 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  6                    53637 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  7                    53644 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  8                    53999 Yes                       No       China (People's … #>  9                    54396 No                        No       China (People's … #> 10                    56587 Yes                       No       China (People's … #> #
